intro: Erica indigesta, commonly known as the common heath, is a species of shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes various evergreen and deciduous shrubs. The plant is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, leathery leaves. It produces bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in spring. Erica indigesta is well adapted to acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
